text: Recently discovered this restaurant even though I've lived in the neighborhood for a while.  Have Done take out here a few times and everything I've tried so far has been very good including the eggplant Parmesan the heirloom tomato salad and the truffle fries.  They have a nice patio on the sidewalk as well and would be great for dining in on a nice evening.

Went here recently on a date and sat outside. The patio was busy but our waitress was attentive and very polite. The ambiance was great and the food was served quickly and cooked to perfection. I would definitely recommend for a date or for a family meal. Very solid Italian spot.

Wow. Happened upon this place when walking down the street en route to another destination - decided to stop in for a quick drink. Ended up getting a few drinks and having dinner.  All I have to say is that they have been in biz for 22 years for a reason. Cannot go wrong eating here!  You can always tell a good Italian restaurant by its bread...  and that bread - with the side of oil and roasted garlic - was excellent. And it only continued from there.  Quaint, warm ambiance, great food - what more can you ask for on a Friday night?! The answer is 'nothing'.

Went back on 6/18/17 for my 70th Birthday meal with my wife. Mentioned the special event when making reservations on Open Table. Ordered my usual Cowboy Steak with Oysters as appetizers and the wife had the Lemon Chicken. Both dishes and appetizer were delicious, and service was fine. Since we had an early reservation (5:00 PM) we were the only customers until about 5:30. A little disappointed there was no mention of the birthday celebration especially since we were the only people there for most of the meal. Still a favorite spot.

Wow, I was so impressed with delivery from Tarantino's! It was amazing how well the food traveled, and I'm sure this place will become a regular on my dinner rotation.  First main was the pork chop (9/10), which had beautiful char marks from the grill and came bone-in. Juicy, tender and perfect if you're craving a big hunk of meat. It was served on a bed of mashed potatoes, jus and cabbage, with a grape chutney that lent a refreshing acidity to the dish. Next up was the fusilli pasta (9/10), which had a surprising amount of flavor despite only using a few ingredients. Creamy yet sweet and spicy, the sauce was seamlessly integrated with the pasta and sausage.  This place is a big win if you're too lazy to make or go out for dinner but still looking for something out of the ordinary.
Finally made it back here again about a month ago, this is really a neighborhood gem. I had the Veal Osso Bucco, and it was amazing.

Location/Atmosphere: This restaurant is located by several other stores, restaurants, and other types of businesses in the Lincoln Park area.  Both metered street parking and valet ($10) parking is available if you are driving here.  CTA train and bus lines are super close by as well.  The interior of the restaurant has several tables and a full bar for seating purposes, but a reservation is highly recommended since it gets pretty crowded.  The exposed brick and relaxed lighting provides an ideal atmosphere for a date night.   Drinks: This place has a nice wine list (mostly by the bottle), but there are cocktails and beer on the menu as well.  The negroni I ordered was well done, and the sazerac was amazing.  I would rate the sazerac to be a 10/10 due to how well balanced it was.   Food: We shared the fried calamari, and I ordered the black linguine as my main dish.  The fried calamari was put on top of a fresh marinara sauce and topped with chopped olives.  This is an appetizer I would likely get again during another visit.  The black linguine is a great option for seafood lovers and has a fantastic flavor to it.  Service:  Our waitress was pleasant, and we received our dishes within a reasonable amount of time with no problem.
Service is snotty and unfriendly. Took forever to get the food and the order was incorrect. Too many other great Italian places in Chicago.

IMHO, Tarantino's is a lovely restaurant that one can happily return to time after time.  The owner, John, and his staff are always gracious and welcoming. The Chef does a great job turning out consistently excellent dishes served in surprisingly generous portions.  We have enjoyed Tarantino's for both cozy meals for a couple as well as larger groups. Highly recommended!
Amazing place! Delicious pasta - get the lamb ragu. Friendly service and nice atmosphere.

Tarantino's is a consistency top notch neighborhood favorite of ours. the food is consistently very good with great mix of usual Italian favorites and some unique offerings. the service is always great and the atmosphere is terrific for a nice evening of conversation and warmth.
Came here one is our first nights living in LP. Service was nice and we sat outside. Food itself was okay. Pastas seemed a bit generic but it satisfied our hunger and were open later.

My friend and I had a tremendous meal here! We order calamari for an appetizer. It was perfectly prepared. We shared a delicious mixed heirloom salad and loved the vinaigrette drizzle over it. I had the salmon and my friend had the chicken parmesan. Both were delicious. We chose to bag our left overs and split a dessert- a creme brûlée. Generally, that would be too small for two people, but Tarantino's provides an ample sized creme brûlée. The service was wonderful!
Tarantino's is one of the best Italian restaurants in Chicago. Their food is so good.

What a great neighborhood restaurant!  The pastas at Tarantino's are always excellent, and we have tried them all.  They're also unbelievably accommodating with minor changes, like switching out the spicy marinara for something mild or adding sausage to a pasta dish. We were pleasantly surprised at the generous portions of the appetizers too - each one is so easy to share at the table. My favorite starters were the grilled polenta with sausage and the hearts of palm salad.  And we never leave without a tiramisu for dessert, also easy to share.
This place looked good and had a nice ambiance, but the food was extremely disappointing.  Especially do not get any of the pizzas!

Went with friends last night.  Ordered Pizza and Calamari for appetizers.  Calamari was really chewy.  Pizza sauce was watery.  Not a great start. Our table had pork chops (amazing!), lemon chicken (very good) and mushroom risotto with duck -  Duck was fine but the risotto itself was both undercooked and underseasoned.  Very disappointing.  Service was professional, the space itself is great..  But not sure we would go back.  The food, particularly at this price point, was wildly inconsistent ranging from great to bad.

We had four of us for dinner last Saturday night, and we had such a great night out. The service, the food and the atmosphere was outstanding! Many of us ordered steaks since we are on a Lenten diet during the week. These rivaled any of the downtown steaks easily. The dessert was also amazing! Great neighborhood spot!

This Lincoln Park gem has it all- great food, warm, friendly vibe and excellent service! The specials are interesting and always worth trying while the regular menu offers a few items I find tough to resist- the two sausage pizza (thin crust) is one of my favorites and the salmon is a winner as well! The menu items are reasonably priced- food and drinks. You're missing out if you don't give this one a try---

We love this place as they always make us feel at home.  The food, staff and atmosphere is outstanding.  You can't go wrong.  I always get the Fusilli as it is my favorite.  We ALWAYS request Sarah as she is attentive, funny and a fellow pet lover :-) If you haven't been, you need to try!!

The girlfriend and I visited last night and had a wonderful experience. We were seated promptly upon our arrival, right on time with our reservation. We asked for bread and oil and it was great --- served with eggplant which was fantastic. We ordered a bottle of Malbec which did not disappoint and our server provided excellent service. She made great suggestions and made sure we wanted for nothing! We ordered the fried oysters for an appetizer, spicy and delicious. She ordered the pork chop and I got the lobster ravioli, both were great. Finished with a Tiramisu and went home happy. Thanks for taking care of us, we'll be back!

Waited over 45 minutes for a table and I had reservations! No 'sorry' or offer of a beverage while we waited. Walked next door to Dee's Chinese and got a table right away. Dee's was so nice, no need to ever eat at Tarantino's again.

I had dinner here the other night with a large group, and Tarantino's didn't disappoint! The salad was fresh, the pasta quite good (although there was so much garlic on the one I wish I had known that before indulging) and what can ever be wrong with Tiramasu? I like that this is a neighborhood place, cute, cozy with the servers and bartenders really knowing their regulars.  And on this Tuesday night, the place was packed so clearly it is supported by the local neighborhood. Sit at the bar, sip your wine and chat with the bartender.  This is old school Italian the way it is supposed to be!

This place looked so cute and my family wAs so excited to try it. We had an outdoor reservation. When we arrived, they sat us inside. We figure it's kind of hot out anyway so we don't say anything. We sat for about 10 minutes before any waitress or anyone came over to us. This gave us time to already decide on our appetizers. We ordered 2 appetizers as we ordered wine. I had to ask for water 3 times before I got one. We finally got bread and she brought over our wine. We placed our orders. Anytime you waned water, you had to try and flag someone down and it seemed impossible. After a while, we almost finished our first bottle of wine and ordered another. She brought it over and was about to start pouring it into my dads glass and he had to mention to her that he needed to taste it first and didn't want her to pour it into his current glass of wine (just in case the new bottle was corked. This is just common knowledge). All of us at our table were discussing how hungry we were and how long it was taking to get our appetizers. At one point we had to ask the hostess if she could get our waitress for us because we hadn't seen her in so long. She finally came over with our meals. My dad proceeded to say thanks, but I don't want my meal yet because we wanted out appetizers first. She completely forgot. She said they had been sitting in the back and she just never went and brought them to us. She asked if she should bring them out and take back our meals. Um, no thank you, I'd rather eat my meal while it's hot than let it go sit back in the kitchen while we eat our appetizers that have been sitting for 45 minutes. I ordered the fussili, which (thank god) was amazing. The food itself was phenomenal, but I would never ever go back to this place because of how poor the service was.

We've eaten at the bar periodically, and although the waitresses/bartendresses always seem to have an attitude, we've enjoyed sparing with them and had a good experience. Tonight they were far more interested in impressing each other than providing service. We had to wave and speak loudly to get attention. Their excuse was one was ther for her first night and was in training. With both clustered around the computer it was a really bad experience and I hope they learned that that level of service means no tip! The restaurant was almost empty and with this level of service will likely stay that way!

Excellent neighborhood Italian joint. The food is great -- my roommates rave about the filet, how it's the best in the city, yada yada yada. Tried it last night and I just may have to agree -- it was super tender and the creamy mushroom sauce was amazing.  The orecchiette with sausage was excellent as well. Ended with the tiramisu which was DOPE. The portions are healthy but not overwhelming. The place has a rustic Italian feel to it, it's never super loud or super busy, but the ambiance is great. If you're in Lincoln Park and craving Italian, look no further.
The black seafood linguini was outstanding. Very nice pizza as well. Service could be better.

Great food, great atmosphere, and great service. I mentioned that it was my birthday when the waitress was at the table, and she put a candle in the dessert we ordered without even being asked to. I will definitely be going back!

Solid four stars.  Impressive cocktails.  I had the key lime infused gin drink which was excellent and that's saying a lot for someone who doesn't particularly care for gin. Shrimp app was great. Salad spot on. Pasta cooked just right.  One note - this place is a firm believer in garlic.
This is the most amaizing restaurant that I have ever been to. My favorite thing to get is the regatoni. They have so many different options. I also love the salmon it is soooooo good.
Order pizzas, mussels or rigatoni. Great place to bring kids before 7 (rigatoni).  After 7 swank enough for a good date. Best restaurant in DePaul hood, believe me. I eat at them all.
Rack of lamb was amazing, beef carpaccio appetizer excellent as well. Great outside service and experience.

Had a quiet dinner here for our anniversary on a Wed night- it was pretty quiet since the hockey playoffs were on and this place has no TV at the bar, but that suited us fine! The wine list is decent, we had a $40 bottle of pinot grigio which was pretty good.  We started w the eggplant parm, which was really good and a large appetizer. We shared the hearts of palm salad which is HUGE and the heirloom tomato salad- this was really good- they make their own balsamic glaze in house. My husband had the salmon special served w green beans and carrots, I had the rigatoni with mushrooms and peas, and parmasean.The pasta portions are huge and fed me for three meals.  We had the rosemary potatoes and asparagus for the side, and the molten lava  cake for dessert.  This is a great place for a small group /casual family dining. Not sure if I would bring kids in the evening-unless it was really early- They open at 5 pm. Parking is street and they have a $10 valet as well. Overall would recommend this place and plan to visit again soon!

Found this place by accident while lost. Needed to eat before going to a play in the area. Been here many times an it never disappoints. Granted, the service can be bad when they get busy but the food is all en pointe.  Big fan of the ribeye, pasta and mussels. Really looking forward to lounging in the outdoor seating area now that the weather is nice again.

The food was good. The portions were a little too big and the lamb lacked flavour. However, the worst part of it all was the service! I am sitting at the restaurant as I type this and they took 10 min to remove our plates and still haven't offered coffee, tea or dessert. The servers keep walking past us without noticing and we're clearly not the only ones who look unhappy about the service. Wouldn't come back.

I have to say I have had better Italian food in the city. The decor was nice and the wine was good but the meal was just ok. The service was good. The tables are so smashed together you can practically eat of the table next to you! Good location and food is good so if you live in the area I would go but if you are in a car I would pick another place if you like better Italian food.

The place was good. I'm not a huge fan of Italian food, but some of my more common food-friends always seem to drag me to one. I wasn't too disappointed with this restaurant. We arrived late on a Sunday, table for 5, all of us showing up at different times. We were accommodated rapidly, not ushered to the bar and told that the entire party had to be there.  This is a big thing for me, because I find it annoying when restaurants make you wait for the entire party, luckily I guess this place was not busy. The hostess gave her recommendations, as did our server. Our party had someone who wanted the Rigatoni without the tomatoes, not only did they leave the tomatoes off, but they switched the creamy tomato sauce out for him. Someone else in our party really wanted spaghetti  and meatballs, which are not on the menu. The server went to the kitchen and returned informing us they would be able to make it for him. So kudus for the restaurant being super friendly, very accommodating, and very fast. The food was pretty good too. Although the butternut squash ravioli, a beloved dish by my wife, was not very good, I'd pass on that. I ordered the fusili which was spicy enough, filled with sausage. We also got the arugula salad, which to me was more meh. Overall, great place to dine. Great service. Good food. Kind of pricey. I'm not counting the days to return, but if we need to go to another Italian place, this would be a consideration.
Consistently great food and friendly atmosphere.  Service is good, portions are generous - sometimes we'll split an entree.

This small neighborhood restaurant is one of my favorite places to eat and enjoy a glass of wine or martini in Chicago. Frequented by locals, Tarantino's has an elegant and cozy atmosphere, delicious food and attentive and friendly service. During my most recent visit the restaurant was beautifully decorated for the holidays with seasonal specials on the menu. I do not recommend making a reservation through an app, just call the restaurant directly. On a Saturday night, the Open Table app only listed available tables at either 6 or 9 pm, however upon arriving at 6, the restaurant had only 3 tables occupied and tables were available during our 2 hour visit. I have also found seating at the bar on every visit. Highly recommended restaurant for couples, small groups and single diners.

Great experience here. We got in with 4 people on a Saturday night and they rearranged some tables to accommodate us. The place is small and cozy, but not too loud. Great music, great ambiance, friendly staff and servers.  More importantly, the food was also excellent. My husband and I were going to share two dishes and asked our server for a recommendation of 2 out of 3 that we were choosing between - her solution was to give us half portions of 2 of them, and a whole portion of the third. We thought that was great service and were THRILLED with the food. We ordered several appetizers that were big enough to share between 3-4 people. And the secret bread is worth requesting - its so easy to just throw a loaf of cold bread and some olive oil on the table, so its nice that they make sure its also great quality. We will be back again!

Very quaint and cozy restaurant. Romantic dim lighting sets the mood for a dinner that hearkens back to 1930s Chicago. More importantly the food is tastefully classic and delicious with some modern touches. Nice selection of wine and cocktails. I would definitely go back.

Had an absolutely great experience at this restaurant. I had never had it before I took my entire family, a group of 12 people, in to eat dinner on a Saturday night. I called that evening to make a reservation and they were very accommodating. I had no idea how small of a restaurant it was, good thing I called ahead. The menu is small, but every single thing on it is absolutely delicious! Totally worth eating at. More of a date night place rather than a group meal.

I used to live nearby and this used to be my favorite local restaurant. On another trip recently I was thoroughly disappointed. All the seafood we ordered was overcooked - I could barely even swallow the salmon, it was so dry. I can't speak to the pasta any more, but I do know that this place can do better. I hope it was just an off day.

The staff was very friendly, and we received good service.   I particularly liked the decor,  but thought the food was average at best compared to other Italian restaurants in the area.  Nothing was outstanding, but Tarantino's is a decent local option.  The bottle of red we ordered was overly warm for some reason, which I didn't like.

Torn between 3 and 4 stars... I enjoyed their simple menu and wasn't overwhelmed by a million choices. We were greeted kindly upon arrival (and exit) and seated promptly Saturday evening and the place was quite busy, with just a few empty tables. We had the eggplant parm to start, and it was delicious. Perfectly seasoned and cooked, and not heavy or greasy at all. However, this took a tad long to come. We waited for our entrees for around 40 minutes and we were starving, so we asked for the bread, which came right away. Now I know why it's only available upon request, because this was one of the best bread I've had. It was super fresh and the accompanied olive oil/eggplant pairing was delish. Our waitress was nice and checked up on us adequately, although never to update us on our status of food or to address the empty bread basket (guess they are stingy with that). She really only ever asked us if we were good on drinks. Our food finally came, and am glad that it came piping hot...so at least it wasn't just sitting at the counter all this time. Either they had some mishaps, have a small kitchen, or it really takes that long to cook our food, but likely the former two. Our waters were constantly refilled though which is always a plus in my book. I had the black linguine and everything was pretty good. I had three giant shrimps that were cooked perfectly. There were many mussels, although small which were also cooked well. The sauce was a light spicy marinara that was perfectly proportioned to my pasta. My bf's butternut squash risotto was amazing and might get that myself next time. It was also nice to see the portions being quite satisfactory. Would definitely come back for the food, but if slow service again, I'm not so sure I would return after that. Also felt that they are more overpriced than need be. Average entrée cost is $20-23, but feel that the upper teens would be the usual overpriced cost for a nice Italian place.

Came here for a sort of last minute dinner based on current location last night. We were greeted nicely right away once we stepped inside and was seated right away. Our server was very friendly and attentive, always coming by to check up on us. Comp bread is upon request, and we could understand why. It was soft and delish, texture was almost perfect.  We ordered the egg parm for appetizer, which was special of the day. It took a while for it to come. It was quite tasty, and surprisingly not heavy. Our actual entrees, however, took even longer. Much longer. Sometimes, I get it feels longer than it really is when you are waiting. But, no. We were actually in conversation for most of the time, but still eventually at some point realized our food still hasn't came. Throughout this time, our server was still consistently checking up on us, but it would have been nice if she updated us on our dinner as well. I'm not sure if that was the norm, because it may have seemed they have a small kitchen, and everything was made to order. Which is fine, but at least give us a status though.  When our entrees did come, it was pretty tasty. Portion sizes were pretty generous as well. My stomach was satisfied. Also, the dinner menu is pretty simple and short. But sometimes, it's nice to keep it that way. No fuss or indecisiveness.  The setting is cozy and comfortable. They also have outdoor seating as well. I'm not sure if anyone has experienced slow food service. But, because the food was delicious, I'd go back to give it another shot.

This place is a JOKE.  Wine and food are fine.  Nothing out of this world.  The kicker is that I came here for my birthday.  Had a table of 12 people who ordered dinner and drinks. Then, after being there for about an hour and a half we were ASKED to get up.  From our table.  And pay the check at the bar.  Yup, that's right. Get up. Take your things with you. Pay your check at the bar. Worst. Service. Ever. You'll know where you can NEVER find me!  Don't frequent this place if you care about yourself or your friends.  It's a nightmare.

I go to Tarrentino's every time I visit Chicago. The food is amazing and the service is incredible. They have a great location right off the El too. They offer great Italian food and have a decent bar (great whiskey selection!).

Really really good. Not sure why it has less stars. Went there bc of it's patio and had great service and even better food.  For starters, they cleaned the high chair. And that was our first experience. We will absolutely being going back.  Inside ambiance felt like a very local upper scale neighborhood restaurant.
Had a great meal at Tarantino's. Sat out on the patio on a very nice evening, service was good and it was one of our best meals in Chicago. Would definitely go back again.
Great neighborhood Italian. Farfalle and saltimboca special were both excellent. Also loved that the waitress let us sample wine. Perfect for a Sunday evening wind down.

Place is phenomenal. Delicious Farfalle with tomatoes, Sautéed spinach, and chicken. Service was excellent and a great date spot if you happen to meet a smoke on Tinder who went to the greatest institution in the land. The Chianti flows like water here. Tarantino's is a must visit. Unless you hate great food, service, and atmosphere.

This is a great neighborhood Italian restaurant. I've been a number of times and have had a wonderful experience each time.  The staff is always helpful and attentive, the food is great and portions generous, the atmosphere is charming with low lights and fun vintage posters. They have outdoor space that's lovely on a spring / summer night. The owner pays attention to details like beautiful fresh cut flowers on the bar. He is often there making sure things run smoothly and chatting with guests. For me this place is about as good as it gets: consistently delivers, reasonably priced (they even have a half-price wine night), friendly people. Every time I leave I'm already looking forward to going back.

Always great food and atmosphere. I've been to Tarantino's many times and have never been disappointed with either the food or service. I can only speak to the taste of the pasta dishes and they're all great- better than in making at home- and that's the key isn't it? Tasty food delivered to your table- and better than made at home.

Beautiful Italian restaurant.  The ambiance is whimsical and the lobster risotto was amazing.  Delicious food all around from the appetizers to the desserts.  I was very pleased with the selections and the specials.  Local neighborhood bars close by, I highly recommend Tarantino's for a first date, last date, any date kind of place.  Owner is very pleasant and gracious, visiting every table on a Thursday night.  I'll definitely visit Tarantino's again.

I personally think that costumer service is one of the most important thing to judge a restraunt on. I saw this restraunt while driving past and thought it would be a perfect place to have dinner. I unfortunately was very disappointed when I walked in and commented to the waiter that it was a bit quiet in the restraunt at the time. And he asked me if i wanted a quiet dinner I said well mot really. Now, I don't mind a normal quiet atmosphere but this place had one other couple and no music to set the mood. Basically it was sad and I was scared to even talk. Then the server snapped at me and my friend saying that this wasn't the restraunt for us. So my friend aske very politely if he could recomend a place to eat at in the area because we obviously felt very unwelcome. The server responded in a very rude manor while walking away giving zero eye contact " uh yeah there's restraunts go find one." We were very suprised an left feeling incredibly uncomfortable. There was also a very odd scent through out the whole restraunt. Just saying.

With all the excellent Italian options in Chicago I would never recommend this place. The food and wine is way overpriced, and the quality is not great. Pasta either undercooked or spent its life decaying under a heat lamp waiting for the chicken part of the chicken parm. Sauce was salty and full oregano. My friends pizza looked small and undercooked. Calamari came with two sauces, but not to dip. Their approach hides the marinara on the bottom of the dish and dumps olive tapenade over top. Who does that? Waitress left us with empty glasses for half the night, dirty dishes for the other half. Lastly, apparently they don't bring out bread unless you "request" it because of gluten free people. That's fine but if I'm dropping $250 maybe you can remember to offer it. No thanks!  This place is easy to get a reservation cuz it sucks.

Fantastic food, service and drinks!  My wife and I shared oysters, pork, butternut squash ravioli and some pasta with seafood and loved everything.  They also had an impressive list of bourbon drinks, which we also loved.

Not necessarily my favorite Italian place in Chicago but definitely at the top of the list. They have daily wine specials which is a bonus and all of their entrees are home made and have such fresh ingredients!

Fantastic for a "last minute date night." I go here quite often with my boyfriend since we live up the street. Have yet to have something we don't like. Plus, 1/2 bottles of wine on Tuesdays is GREAT.

This place is delicious! I work at the salon across the street and all my clients are always asking me how this place is. So my husband and I decided to try it, and I LOVE it. It's a very intimate environment and the food is amazing, my husband who is a picky eater nearly licked the plate lol.

We've been here a few times and--wow--is it delicious! On the most recent visit, my wife got the filet, and I got the chicken parmesan. The filet was cooked perfectly and had amazing flavor. The hint of truffle was just right. The chicken parmesan was very good, but the highlight was their tomato sauce. It is definitely a new favorite sauce for me. It had just the right amount of sweetness. I really couldn't get enough of it. The staff was incredibly friendly as well, and the service was fast. It was pretty much a perfect dinner.

My boyfriend and I went here for an anniversary dinner a few weeks ago.  It's very close to home and I'd always wanted to try it but the menu was a little too pricey for just any day.  We went on a Tuesday, which was lucky because they had half price bottles of wine!  I ordered the black linguine for dinner, which was okay.  Maybe it was the quality, or maybe I just overestimated how much I like muscles...the texture became a little overwhelming after awhile. My boyfriend got the chicken parmesan and definitely liked his dish way more than I liked mine.  Overall: good, but I wouldn't go back for two full entrees again.

Constantly on the hunt for a neighborhood restaurant that offers the perfect combo of service, ambiance and great tastes, this one fell short. Way short. Kudos to the friendly wait staff, but no matter how nice you were and how many times you refilled our water, it just didn't make up for the lifeless, tasteless, spineless, pizza less, pizza we ordered. If we closed our eyes, we could have sworn we were in an airport cafeteria or high school cooking class. Sorry, but we won't be back. A shame, because all of the potential is there.

I bring every out of townee to Tarantino's.  It is the purest form of neighborhood Chicago Italian.  I could swim in a vat of the truffle butter that comes with the Filet Mignon.  It's perfect.  My brother and I had the shrimp stuffed pepper that was a special in December.  We will be attempting to recreate it this coming Christmas for our annual Feast of the Seven Fishes.  Another special was Italian sausage and polenta.  I haven't had such Italian tasting sausage in Chicago.  Wine is 100% on point.  The only change I'd make is to add some music.

One of my favorites! I love the atmosphere, all the staff are super friendly, and the food is great! I love when they have 'parties' for the holidays because they usually have free appetizers and desserts! One of my favorite places to hang out at the bar and have a glass of wine or two, or to bring my family when they are in town. I have never disliked anything I have eaten here!

We had a terrific meal. The food was exceptional, fried oysters and soft shell crabs were out of this world. May be among the best I've experienced. That is where it ended.  A nice place like this with a chef who is on must be made aware that our server was not on and may prevent our return. Dilly dallying and spending time with other, larger tables, screwing up the drink order from forgetting bread and then serving our salad after the meal. The entree came out with the appetizer and she never came back for the check. In fact, another server took my card and signed us up, while we watched our server talk with another patron. What a shame. Great food with below amateur service. You'll know who she is as I'm sure she is bitching about her lousy 10%.

A group of five of us theatergoers went to dinner with a reservation on Sunday May5, 2013. When I made the reservation I requested a round table. We discussed thiis as they have to put side up to make a round table.  When we arrived, there was no round table set up When I inquired as to why, the staff worked to get one up. For some reason of which I am unaware, our server, Christie (;) was quite unfriendly to us the entire evening  We may not have been the party she would have liked to serve but I have really no idea.  In spite of her chilly service we made our own good time.  I have been to this restaurant many times and the food keeps bringing me back.. I understand that people may have bad days but professionalism requires demeanor.  I will absolutely go back but I would hope the management addresses these two issues.

This place was great!  My fiancee and I went to Tarantino's for Valentine's Day, and we had a great meal.  We started with the Fried Calamari, which was crunchy and had a ton of flavor.  Regarding the entrees, we ordered the Lobster Risotto and Salmon entrees.  The Risotto was rich and the consistency was perfect (not too creamy and not too thick), which a nice lobster tail on top.  The Salmon was, in a word, savory.  The Salmon didn't have a "fishy" taste, and was perfect!  With a little lemon squirted on top, you can't do much better. Overall, this was a really good restaurant with a great environment.  If you are considering this restaurant, definitely make it happen!

The location in Lincoln Park is wonderful and the decor inside is adorable.  It reminded me of my days living in Paris or Rome and stumbling into a great cafe for a long dinner.  The energy of the restaurant is on point for the neighborhood and romantic as well.   All of the food is definitely homemade, including homemade pasta.  I did not love the food overall, although a couple of the items we ordered were really good.  We liked the sausage on the fried polenta and the truffled fries as well.  The salmon and ravioli were OK.  The fried polenta was flavorless and had bad texture.  The wine less was fairly extensive and had a nice range of bottles from $30s-$100s.   I would have given the restaurant 3 stars because the quality of the food was good and the restaurant was really quaint; however, our waitress seemed kind of uncomfortable after she asked us how we liked the polenta and we responded that it was lacking flavor.  After that, she wasn't very responsive and didn't inquire as to our thoughts about the food.  Maybe she was just busy, but she was so friendly at the beginning, and by the end she seemed like she was ready for us to go.

Likely the best value when it comes to Italian in Chicago. The calamari and risotto are stellar, while the vibe is great for small talk or deep conversation. A few good beers on tap and a killer butternut squash ravioli have me sold. The service can sometimes be a bit stiff, but if you get the dude in the beard who sometimes works the bar, your evening is money.

Solid choice.  Pork chop was recommended by the bartender.  So delicious!  Cooked medium rare as recommended by the chef.  My wife had a pasta dish which she loved.  We will definitely return when we visit this neighborhood again.

Tarantino's is a great place for steak and wine. It is cozy with great ambiance, fantastic food and wonderful service. The food... Their Fillet Mignon with mushrooms and truffle butter gets more delicious with every bite and their rigatoni is also very flavorful. I highly recommend this place as the food is delicious and the prices very reasonable. The staff is also very helpful and attentive.

So good.  I've been to Tarantino's 3 or 4 times now, and it never fails.  A bit on the pricey side for Italian, but SO worth it.  This is not your out-of-the jar sauce and pasta.  The dishes are always delicious and plentiful, the atmosphere is lively but neighborhoodish, the wine list is awesome--I can't say enough good things. One of my favorites.

Pork is TO DIE FOR.  So good.  Nice neighborhood spot.  Outside seating is always packed on a nice day.  Cozy on the inside.  Good service too.  This is definitely a place to take family or friends if you are showing them the neighborhood and want a relaxed and solid place to eat.

We were so pleasantly surprised! We lived over here for a year and never made it to Tarantino's because it was just a little past our normal perimeter, but we were walking by recently and decided to try it out, mostly (to be honest) for the patio. The food was really solid, and you can get half portions of the pastas, which made me try something more decadent knowing I didn't also have to eat the leftovers. The husband got a seafood dish, and that was great too. It turned out to be a half-price wine night, so we got a bottle with the waitress's help when they were out of the one we'd had in mind. We seemed to be surrounded by a couple of regulars because the other waitress seemed to know them, which was nice. It felt like a real neighborhood place, a dependable spot to take a group or your family where everyone can find something they'll like. Nice to know it's here.

Fantastic Italian!! I recently went here with my family for my grandmother's birthday. It's charming little restaurant with amazing ambiance.  The food is also excellent. We ordered the bruschetta appetizer, pizza, filet mignon, a couple of pasta dishes, creme brulee and tiramisu. Everything was wonderfully prepared and beautifully presented.  It's quiet and neighbor-hoody. Perfect for family meal or for date night.

This is our favorite neighborhood restaurant.  We can always count on Tarantino's for a good meal.  I have had almost everything on the menu and always leave happy and more than satisfied. The Fusilli pasta is my fave, it seems really basic with just sausage and tomato cream sauce but let me tell you it's a party in your mouth.  Small pieces of delicious sausage and the tomato cream sauce is a little spicy and not to creamy, actually if the menu didn't say cream I would never describe it as cream sauce.   The ambiance is  comfortable, warm and cozy.  The service is friendly and prompt.

We visited Tarantino's on a half off Wine Tuesday.  Initially, we enjoyed our experience. The calamari was very rubbery. The hearts of palm salad was fine. As was our pizza, in spite of the fact that we ordered the smoked chicken pizza and were told we could substitute spinach for red pepper but failed to get the red onion and asparagus that were also part of that menu selection. In addition, our bill showed our entire Visa number instead of just the last four digits.  Our server did not seem too concerned about this security issue. Beware!

Went here for the first time this weekend for a birthday dinner. We had the filet mignon, rigatoni, mozzarella pizza and a special of the night of copper creek salmon. Desserts of tiramisu and creme brulee' No complaints at the table. The food was excellent.  The atmosphere was simple elegance and the noise level low. Valet parking was a bonus.I would highly recommend this place.

I took my parents here for dinner their first night in the city and wish I had made a different choice. When first arriving, I was excited to see that the restaurant was everything I thought it would be: cozy, warm, and inviting. Unfortunately, the experience went downhill from there. After being sat, we waited for about 10 minutes for a waiter to come and greet us. He didn't apologize for the wait - and we couldn't understand why it took so long since the place was only half full. He asked if we wanted wine, but we had never been given a wine menu so... more waiting while he went to find one. When he came back again to take the order, we asked what beer was on tap but he didn't know and had to go check... more waiting. When we followed up with "what kind of goose island" he didn't know. (He seemed confused when we followed up with.. "is it the 312, the Green Line?). The timing of the meal was off from then on. Our appetizer came before our drinks. Our food came about 30 minutes after we had finished our appetizers. The waiter never came to ask if we wanted any other drinks after our meal arrived (especially annoying because I told him that I would order wine with my meal when he first took our order). We also never got bread with our meal, which he said was because it was 'in the oven.' When they finally brought it out, we were just about finished with our meals. The food, which others had raved about, I though was just average. My pasta was overcooked (I got the black pasta) which was disappointing for an Italian restaurant. I really wanted to like this place - and giving them the benefit of the doubt, you could say that we just had a very new and inexperienced waiter -- but I was not at all impressed and will definitely not return.
Excellent service, good food, decor and ambiance conducive to fine and fun dining. A bit noisy.

Came here last night with my cousin for dinner. It's only 2 blocks from my apartment and I couldn't believe I've never noticed the place. It had a nice ambiance, great for a date night. It was a Tuesday night and much to our liking it also happened to be half price bottles of wine. My cousin did that wine choosing, a mild red, and it was very good. She had been before and said that their mussels were amazing. So clearly that was what he ordered for our app and it did not disappoint. Seriously, the butter garlic sauce that the mussels were in made my mouth water and we soped it all up with extra bread. Like I could have drank the stuff, it was that ridiculous! For my entree, I had one of the evenings specials, salmon in a lemon caper sauce, green beans, and whipped mashed potatoes. It was seasoned well, moist, and the lemon caper sauce was delicious. My cousin got the chicken parm and thought it was very good too! All the pastas sounded great, but I was in the mood for something not so heavy. However, I will be back again to try them!

Solid Italian food! I had been wanting to try this place for a while, and we finally made reservations prior to seeing a show the other night. The inside is a lot more intimate than I anticipated - very warm and welcoming with all the wood and exposed brick. As for the food, I was very impressed. I ordered the grilled swordfish which was delicious! It has such a great flavor and was cooked perfectly. My dad ordered the Fusilli which I thought was a stand out. It had a really nice spice to it, and when I go again, I am getting that!

The Black Linguine was incredible! Perfectly spicy tomato sauce, perfectly cooked linguine, generous portions of large shrimp and lots of mussels. Only reason they lose a star is because when we walked in we waited up front and 2 of the female waitstaff kinda glanced over at us from the bar and kind of ignored us. Yes, it was a Sunday night a half an hour before close but still! When we finally said something they told us to wait and a male server came to seat us and took good care of us.

Great service, friendly staff, fantastic food. Love the calamari (grilled or fried) and all of their pasta dishes and pizza. Great "filthy dirty martinis"...charming interior, great place to catch up and have a drink/dinner with friends. Mr. Tarantino is always very charming and welcoming.
Used to come here a lot when I went to Depaul.  Had the pork chop,,,,,,,great! waitress....Great and wine was perfectly matched......I love the smoked chicken pasta as well

Had the fried calamari to start. It was definitely overcooked. I'm a huge calamari fan and I know it's tough to do right, but at their prices I expect more. The rest of the food was great: I definitely recommend the lobster ravioli. A good selection of wine and they know how to make a great martini. A solid experience.

I came here for a girls night out dinner with a group of 4. The place isn't too big and we were kind of surprised that we were able to get a reservation calling only an hour in advance. We were seated in one of their round tables in the middle. Our waiter was very attentive and friendly and reminded me of Christian Kane =O. Compared to other similar restaurants, this place isn't as dressy, which gives it a neighborly feel. I still wouldn't wear a hoodie, but maybe nice casual would be okay.  Now onto the food: I had the mussels appetizer and pork chop entree. The mussels were aplenty and delicious. The pork chop dish sounds so simple... but one bite of those grape chutneys... foodgasm. I tried the bruschetta and chicken parmesan that my friends ordered as well and they were good, but I definitely liked what I ordered better.  This place is a hidden gem. I will definitely be returning.

My husband and I have been huge fans of this awesome neighborhood restaurant for years. The food is phenomenal and the staff is very friendly! Our favorite dishes are the lobster ravioli, the fusily and the lamb!

Three words people - Butternut Squash Ravioli. OK, so three more words - it's damn good. OK, really.  I originally went here off of a co-worker's recommendation.  I had just started dating a girl, it was her birthday, I wanted to do something special for her.  Called ahead to make a special arrangement for the occasion, which they gladly accommodated like they do it all the time.  Long story short - food was spectacular, wine list was well balanced, service was friendly and funny without being overbearing, and the atmosphere was perfect - not too formal to feel stuffy, but not casual enough so that it didn't feel like an early date and a birthday dinner. Oh, and the girl - well, in case you're curious, we're still together.  She's still in a trance from the food.  Yes, I am kidding...at least I hope I am.  I don't credit Tarantino's for all the success there, but it sure didn't hurt as a great place for a date.

Gem of a restaurant.  We had the privilege of meeting the owner John.  He's warm and inviting as is his staff.  We adore this place!  The mussels, beet salad and cowboy steak top our list!  And this is an Italian restaurant so the pasta dishes never disappoint.  Wonderful specials that are well thought out.  A wine menu that is comprehensive and affordable.  All around a wonderful experience.  Thanks John, Krissy and Ryan for an enjoyable evening.  We will be back very soon.

I ate here yesterday for my date's 21st birthday and it was offensively bad. The calamari was soggy, the fish and potatoes were dry, and the shrimp was cooked in a way that there was absolutely no flavor. The pasta was okay but left a lot to be desired. I'm not much of a foodie, but this was bad even by normal dining standards. I had a better meal at coco pazzo cafe for lunch yesterday ($10 sandwich), and a better meal today at go roma ($7 sandwich). I'm also not a wine expert, so I usually go for one of the cheaper wines on the menu, which is fine at a Prosecco or Coco Pazzo, but my advice would be to steer clear of the cheap bottle of Chardonnay at Tarrantino's. I drank one and a half glasses (it was awful), my date had maybe one or two sips. All in all, $110 including tip for one of the most awful restaurant meals I've ever experienced. We will re-celebrate her birthday somewhere else.

Perfect service, excellent food and half price bottles of wine on Tuesday made this place a win for us.  Started off with cornfried oysters. They were perfectly cooked and balanced nicely wih the dressing that came with them. We also had goat cheese stuffed figs wrapped with bacon. Another interesting blend that I was not expecting. The gf thought the dish could be a little sweeter but I had no problems with it.  The main course was lobster stuffed ravioli. The sauce was extraordinary but their could have been a bit more filling and the pasta on the ravioli was far too thick. Overall a really good experience that will bring me back.
Solid throughout......steak and Italian dishes are all great

We thought we'd try this place for our son's birthday. It's always got customers, is clean and charming and smells great when you walk by! We got there after a family disaster which truly soured the night. The staff was extremely accomodating abd made things great for us. Our meals were basic (as we picked...) but very tasty. The service was impeccable and the night was better! We will definitely come again, this is the exact trype of corner restaurant that one might find in Tribeca or Greenwich Village. This place is a class act.

Definitely a must-go spot in Chicago. I have been there twice with diffrent firends. All my friends give a big thumb up to Tarantino's. Honestly, I never tried authetic Itlaian food in my country, so I feel delightful when I found this great place in my neighberhood.   First, the bread before the main course is impressive, I don't know if I am starving or what, I think  the bread there is the best I've ever eaten in Chicago area. We ordered pork chop, chicken breast, and herb rack of lamb. In general, I am not a big fan of lamb, in fact, I don't like to eat lamb  But the lamb is just so tasty and I cannot help but order  twice when I go with diffrent group of my firends. My friend  liked  their chop pork as well, the big portion size made him happy and statisfied. Also, the waiter was kind and patiently explained each item on the menu.  Although the price is a little too high for students, I think it is valuable because of the good service, nice food, and lovely environment. I will be coming back for sure.

I have always thought fondly of Tarantino's (the size of the restaurant and decor make it totally "my kind of place") but, after dining there again recently, I was reminded that it leaves a lot to be desired in terms of the quality of the food and the service as both are simply mediocre. And mediocre does not suffice at their prices or in a city with so many GREAT Italian restaurants. Do yourself a favor and dine at ANY of the Francesca's restaurants instead.

Definitely a great local spot.  The food was delicious!  The prices are a little bit above average, but worth it.  They have nice outdoor seating.  The service was the only thing that was lacking.  The server approached us immediately upon being seated.  We hadn't even picked up the drink menu yet.  It took about 20 minutes for the server to return.  Once he came back, service did improve.  Overall I would come back.

Very good dining experience. Ate here before going over to see The Million Dollar Quartet. Very unique menu, delicious pasta. Son got the pork chop & it was really good.  We finished with Tiramisu and the molteten choc cake; also very good. Service was excellent. We'll be back.

"Hey, what do you want to do Friday night?"  "Ohhh I don't know. I was kind of thinking about taking a swim in Tarantino's pinot noir mushroom truffle sauce."  "Ooo that sounds good. I think I'll join you."  "Well good because I think I will need a little assistance eating the 10 oz filet mignon that goes underneath the amazing sauce for only $30.00"  THIS PLACE IS FANTASTIC!  I mean seriously. Everything we tasted was perfect : beef carpacio, parmesan shrimp, lobster ravioli, veal scalopini and my favorite the filet mignon - the sauce on which is just so decadent you HAVE to sop up every last drop with warm italian bread.  Service was fine - nothing extraordinary. Italian restaurants should know to bring out pasta dishes before main courses - this place didn't seem to know that or offer, but whatever. My mind can only concentrate on that filet mignon sauce. You HAVE to try it.

I'm new to Yelp, but not new to excellent dining. While our waiter was a bit stuffy and snobbish, we were able to overcome due to our prompt seating and delicious meal. I will definitely come back here another time - one of my new favorite places!

I visited Tarantino's in mid-March with my girlfriend and WOW! The atmosphere was homey, warm,and really makes you want to hunker down and, well, just EAT. Our waiter looked like a cross between Matthew Mcconaughey and Bradley Cooper -- he had a voice for radio but a face for the silver screen, ladies! Even more delightful was the food. I had the Pork Chop, and it was so good I could've sworn that the heart-throb waiter ran down a lean hog in the alleyway and cooked him up right then and there. I felt like Fred Flinstone tearing away at the meaty thigh of a Stegasaurus as I gazed across the table to find my lady going to town on her voluptuous Mussels. The only thing that could have made this experience more enjoyable would have been getting wheeled out on a Jazzy Chair, in all my glory, after just consuming some of the best food mankind has ever engineered.

My friends and I came here accidentally. However, we all feel we really came to the right place. The bread before the meal is really great. We had two baskets of bread. We ordered the pork chop and the herb lamb. I really like the pork chop. It tastes really great and 11 oz  is definitely enough for your stomach. I tried some lamb as well. My friends like it very much but I think pork chop is better. The service is great and the waiter is kind. The only downside is the price, maybe a little bit expensive for students.
Great place to take a date, nice and quiet.  I would go on Sunday's as they have great specials.  Get the smoked chicken and bow tie pasta, it was fantastic

Terrific place! My wife and I are new to Chicago and were invited here by a new vendor to our company. We were impressed the minute we walked in the door. The ambiance and decor are first class. You could smell the savory food immediately.  We shared the baby green salad which was complete with what I can  only describe as a delicious blend of pickeled onions, fresh greens accompanied with fantastic dressing. The service staff recognized we had some business to discuss before we chowed down and there was no pressure to order right away.  The menu selections were llimited compared to other resturants we have been but perfectly balanced within the types of dishes one expectets for Italian. Actually the menu was just perfect. I had the pork chop wiith whipped potatos and a vegetable ragu, and my wife had the lamb chops with polenta and brussel sprouts. Both were served hot and outstandingly well balanced. Everything was cooked, seasoned, and presented to perfecton.  Without doubt we are going to take visiting family and friends here to share in the outstanding experience. This was an outstanding dining experience.

Good service, good food, good wine. It's a lovely atmosphere and if you walk in 15 minutes before they technically open, they're incredibly welcoming.  Had a glass of wine, mustard crusted salmon (yay!), and a nice conversation with the bartender.  I've said a lot of good things about this place, but you really really can't go wrong here.

I love this place.  A nice neighborhood feel, service is very good, menu is changed often enough and it's not so loud that you can't have a conversation.  Don't park in the neighborhood - do the valet or the ticket will cost you $50

This is a bit atypical but I ate at Tarantino's over 2 years ago, I took a business card because it was good and moving apartments found the card prompting this long overdue Yelp review.   This place rocked and I'm assuming it still rocks.  It was so good I can still remember what I had: lamb ragout gnocchi.  Twas A-mazing.  The gnocchi had nice weight to it but wasn't overstuffing and the lamb was tender and flakey, like pulled pork moist.  It's a nice interior, classy but not overly dressy.  They also have nice outdoor seating.  Next time I'm in Chicago, I will definitely go out of my way to revisit this place.

SOOO GOOD!!! They have excellent food. The pasta was fantastic!!! I had a romantic dinner with my date here this past summer. The service and the food were great and I even got to bring Spencer along because we sat outside!!!!  This is were I first tried Matilda beer and I liked it. They also have a great wine selection. Here's the NITTY GRITTY aMbIaNcE = The inside was not that large, but it was very NICE.  sTaff- FRIENDLY and KNOWLEDGEABLE pRiCe= The bill was pretty hefty, but WORTH EVERY CENT!!! fOOd= let me repeat SOOOOO GOOD!!! I'll be back, I just need to find another date to take me.

We went here on New Years Eve. I say it was beyond expecatations! The lobster bisque was awesome, and my husband had the sausage and polenta appetizer which was also awesome. The salmon was great and so was the rigatoni was delicious. I think one of the best things was the food was HOT. It wasn't warm or had been sitting around it was served ready. the service was first rate, the wine also first rate. great atmosphere and overall just a wonderful experience. With the prices so reasonable we cannot wait to return!

My favorite Italian restaurant in Chicago with good wine list. I love grilled polenta, corn fried oysters and mussels appetizers. I always order the spicy black linguini with shrimp & mussels.  Also love the lamb with polenta and butternut squash ravioli. The Italian wines have been good.  The atmosphere is very warm and inviting. Service is excellent and friendly. Easy access to Armitage brown line station which is 5 blocks away. It's a great family owned eatery.

If you think this place must be doing something right to be around for 15 years, you are right. The food is delicious. I ordered chicken parmesan, which can easily be forgettable, but it was great. The chicken was moist and the toppings were perfect. Also tried the black linguine with seafood, and it's a winner. Their starter salads are easily large enough to be shared. Tuesdays are half price bottles of wine. Order the Lodi Zin!

Atmosphere was cute, pleasant but not exciting. Service was good although they were not willing to work with us on a  restaurant.com  that had fine print requiring a minimum of 4 people & we I only had 2. I got the risotto it was delicious, my friend got chicken it looked a little more boring but she liked it. The dipping sauce with the bread was very good, whatever it was.

The place is super cute. Love the feel of the restaurant, the food overall was good for the price. Nothing amazing that will make this place become my new go to italian date place, but also enjoyeable enough to return. Service was ok but sooooo slow.  note to those with a sweet tooth - avoid the lemon sorbet. Way too overly sour.

Who knew Tarantino's has been around for 15 years? And it only has 48 reviews? Wow, this place is a well-kept secret, it seems.  I always thought it looked cute and wanted to try but then I'd forget all about it and go somewhere else.  Keri had recently been here, loved it, and wanted to go back, so we decided to eat here last night. It was just the right choice for a Sunday night; it was lively in here, but not loud, and the atmosphere exuded warmth. We each started with a glass of red wine while we looked over the menu; a Napa Cabernet for her, and a Lodi Zinfandel for me. Their wine list was small, but thoughtfully chosen. For starters, I opted for the carpaccio and she ordered a Caesar salad. The appetizers were very good, but not so filling that we'd ruin our appetites.  I had a hard time deciding between the tagliatelle with vegetables and the butternut squash ravioli, but since Keri was ordering the ravioli, it just made sense that I shouldn't order the same thing since I knew she'd give me a taste. To that we also ordered some polenta fries which we 'd share.  Our mains arrived and mine looked even better than the menu described. It was fettucine-like noodles in a light garlic-olive oil sauce, positively brimming over with colorful, sauteed vegetables. The sauce was delicate and could have used a little bit more garlic, but the vegetables were full of flavor. I counted no less than eight different ones used: spinach, tomatoes, mushrooms, peas, carrots, zucchini, asparagus, and red and yellow peppers. I absolutely loved it.  Keri's pasta was equally as good, if a tad rich, but it was a butter-sage sauce, so richness was to be expected. Her pasta had a nice balance of flavors though - sweet from the squash, buttery from the sauce, herby from the sage, and nutty from the parmesan and pine nuts. I'm not sure I could have eaten such a decadent dish for my entree, but a half-order as an appetizer would be ideal.  We were halfway through our pastas when the server tried to bring over an order of truffle fries. While they looked great, we explained that we ordered polenta fries. It was another ten minutes before the polenta fries were brought to us, but our server said she would comp them since we had to wait so long. That was appreciated.  We declined to order dessert since we were both full, but I did note that they have profiteroles on the dessert menu, which is one of my favorites, so I'll be sure and save room next time I come here.  Service was gracious and efficient (save for the polenta fries snafu). I thought the prices were a tad high for vegetarian pasta dishes, but not so much that it would keep me from returning.

I was not that impressed with the food here. I felt like it was typical Italian food just marked up in price.  I did really like the pepperoncini and prosciutto pizza.    The pasta was pretty good, but nothing special.  I found the restaurant to be overcrowded and too loud.  I went for Sweetest Day and I found it frustrating that I could not even understand what my date was saying to me!  The service was good, but I wish I would have been the table next to me, because the waiter kept bringing the girl free martinis and refills all night.  I don't know how she was able to stand at the end of the meal.  This is fine if you want to give your friends free stuff, but just don't be so obvious about it!

The right restaurant at the right time and place for us. Thoroughly enjoyed walking around the Lincoln Park neighborhoods and Tarantino's strikes me as being a nice, neighborhood kind of place. When I'm in an Italian restaurant, I get an insane craving for arugula. Called 'rocket' in Germany, it just brings back so many happy memories of my travels. The Beet Salad with a generous helping of arugula, green apples, walnuts and gorgonzola cheese was one of my favorite dishes on our trip to Chicago. The Arugula Salad with a risotto cake and shaved parmesan was also simple and excellent. There were no weak points on the entrees (we chose a daily special), side dishes and we ordered Chianti by the glass. Beautiful dining atmosphere with brick walls and low lighting. On a warm evening the patio was very popular, but we dined inside.  We were sitting in a row of tables for two and they are a little cramped. I would have loved a little more space rather than hear the intimate details of my neighbors remodeling plans.  The server was wonderfully attentive and never had to ask for anything since all of our needs were anticipated. Not what I would call a special occasion or casual place. Prices are a little on the high side, but not painfully so. It is the happy medium.
Great apps (goat cheese stuffed figs), great salad, great tiramisu, OK Chicken Parmesan. Service was really good too. We'd go again.

I visited here for a special occasion type of dinner, and from start to finish everything was great. I had a special risotto, while others had some delicious, interesting pasta dishes and the chicken parm. The portions were huge and the flavors were savory.

My girlfriend and I have been driving by Tarantino's for months and have been excited to try this little Italian restaurant on Armitage. With the weather now warm, we finally went the other night without making a reservation. When we showed up, all the tables outside were full and the inside was rented out for a private event. We wanted to eat outside anyway and the owner was very quick to get us a table (we waited 4 minutes). That was the best service we received for the rest of the night as there was only one waitress for about 12 tables in the outside area. The bread we were served was awesome, but I was disappointed by the beer selection (which included Newcastle and Harp on draft, bud light, Heineken and a couple other domestics by the bottle). I know it is an Italian restaurant, but the beer selection was still brutal. The menu was fairly extensive and had dishes from farfalle pasta to braised lamb shank. I ordered fried oysters with spicy mayo and pico de gallo for an appetizer and salmon with greenbeans and corn/bean salsa as the main course. My girlfriend ordered a braised pork chop and a garden salad. The oysters were great, very well done and the sauce was amazing, the salad was also very good. I wish I had ordered another appetizer because the entrée took 50 minutes to arrive as we snacked on bread. My salmon was overcooked, the greenbeans were very plain and the salsa was not fresh. I have never asked a waiter to return my food, this was a first, and I felt like a jerk doing it, but for an expensive Italian restaurant the entrée was unacceptable. I got my meal replaced with a farfalle pasta dish that arrived in five minutes. The pasta was undercooked and the sauce was tasty, but there was nothing special about it. I felt that I could cook the same pasta dish at home for 1/10 the price. The pork chop was better than my overcooked salmon, but the side of mashed potatoes was a little cold. It was hard to get the waitresses' attention for water refills and additional glasses of wine as she was the only one out there. They could have used at least one more person on staff that night. The owner was very nice and it seemed that there were plenty or regulars there with whom he sat down and chatted with. At the end of our 2 hours 15 minute meal, I was extremely disappointed with my meal-especially after wanting to try it for so long. I will not give Tarantino's another chance as I know there are plenty of other Italian restaurants in the city.

Where to begin? At the beginning. Arrived here just past 9:00PM last night. The restaurant was decently full but starting to thin out. We were seated immediately by a very polite hostess with whom we quipped about the stickiness of the air outside.  We sat undisturbed for a couple minutes getting our bearings of the interior of the restaurant. From the outside Tarantinos looks like a dark, cozy romantic spot. Of all the times I've passed (hundreds) and never come in, I never would have expected it to be so modern and open on the inside. It's perfectly decorated and lit, and has an old Chicago-style ceiling that I love.  The first course of mojito martinis ripened our appetites, and prepared us stiffly for the amazing meal to follow.  Appetizers of Heirloom Tomatoes and Parmesan Shrimp were both portioned quite well; not too large, not too small. They were both superbly complimented with contrasting flavors. The Parmesan Shrimp were simply awesome.  The Black Linguini and special Shrimp and Vegetable Risotto were fantastic. That's basically all there is to say.  Also, get the Chocolate Molten Cake... And now, a word about our waiter. Thomas was his name and he was spectacular. I think he is the best waiter my girlfriend and I have had in a very long time. He gave us time, never rushed us. He spoke to us like he had secrets that we needed to know and he was sharing them with us. This made my girlfriend have a crush on him, which I completely understood. Management, if you're reading this: give this man a raise.

I've been here a few times now with friends and with kids... the staff are really accomodating and it's always been a good experience. This is not a Michelin star restaurant but is certainly a good italian; dare I say rustic, full of flavor etc.  I've not had a bad meal here and it's good value with reasonable wines, I'll be going back for sure...

Had a first date here on a Saturday night. Got there at 7pm and crowd was pretty thin. Apparently it doesn't get busy till 8pm.  Atmosphere was great, waitstaff was attendant. Wine list was pretty good too. My date had the pork chop (which the waitress claimed was the best in Chicago) and I had the breaded veal. Both dishes were delicious. Reasonably priced too. Would definitely come back.

Delicious food.  Good portion size. Went with a group of 4 couples.  We had a big table in the front.  The wine and food were both super yummy. I'd definitely go back...though only for special occasions.  I did think it was a bit pricey.  Worth it, but not an everyday place for me.

This is a quaint little restaurant in Lincoln Park with a large bar and extremely helpful wait staff. It was a little pricey, however, the food was delicious. I had the butternut squash ravioli. They bring out an eggplant appetizer in olive oil with fresh warm bread to start. Our waiter was charming.  The only negative thing that I have to say is that we arrived early, about 4:55 PM and they open at 5 PM. The doors were locked and many employees were inside. No hours were posted outside. No one would come to the door and tell us they didn't open for 5 minutes. That was somewhat frustrating.

If we are in Lincoln Park this is a definite stop for us. We've been here over 20 times and I don't recall any bad experiences. It's consistently good food, service, and the atmosphere is great. Our friends know the owner well, and introduced us to this place years ago, and I'm glad they did. Parmesan Shrimp- It's on a bed of arugula and it's fried. I don't think they mention that. But it's good. Grilled calamari- Great 2 Sausage Pizza- Awesome Arugula salad- LOVE it, but I love arugula. Hearts of Palm Salad- Since the day I first had this, I have been mimicking it at home. It's always a hit at dinner parties and such a delicious combo of hearts of palm, tomatoes and avocado with a lemon dressing. Farfalle- Smoked Chicken, tomatoes, spinach- wonderful Rigatoni- mushroom, sun dried tomatoes, prosciutto, peas in a cream sauce. Love it. Fusilli- Sausage and a spicy red sauce. My husband always gets this. Tagliatelle- Spinach, mushroom, goat cheese. Yum. One thing I must complain about. Their monkfish. I had it here twice on special and it was awesome. So I have tried it a few other places because I thought I loved monkfish. I don't. Unless it's made here, so Tarantino's owes me a couple hundy for frigging that one up.

My boyfriend and I went to Tarantino's for Valentine's Day and had a nice evening. The ambiance of the restaurant is very cute and enjoyable. The service was also very good, I would easily rate it above average. The food itself was very average on the whole, with a few bright spots. Their ciabatta bread is some of the best I've ever had and I could have probably just eaten that for dinner, ha. We both started with salads (me: Arugula, him: Caesar), which were fine... not memorable in any way. My lobster risotto looked and tasted like rice-a-roni. Not exactly what I was expecting when I ordered risotto. I'd avoid any risotto dish there in the future. His chicken parmesan --- the chicken cutlet itself was very good; however, the marinara was sub-par. Also of note -- the portions were enormous. All in all.... average food was supplemented by a charming atmosphere and good service.

This place was wonderful in terms of food, service, and ambiance.  A definite date place!   The photo provided here isn't as nice as it looks in person.   I would say the price range approached $$$, though, once you throw in wine and an appetizer.  I look forward to returning.

Fab neighborhood restaurant in Lincoln Park. Very nice bar area which was incredibly busy and crowded when we went (a Friday night). There was a real nice buzz and atmosphere. Service was a bit disorganized while we waited for our table which was 30 minutes late but they did give us our drinks free which helped! :) Magarita was fine and Martini pretty good. The calamari was tasty, light and avoided being too chewy. The mussels were a great appetizer, plump with enough zing to make them really tasty. For entrees the salmon was light and flaky (huge portion) and the rack of lack perfectly cooked to medium rare.  the lamb had great flavors and was sooo tender. The potatoes were a bit average though. Good wine list and nice to see them focus more on Italian choices rather than just the usual US suspects. The Amerone was a top choice. All in all a really nice restaurant. We'll be back for sure.

best italian place in lincoln park.  sit outside in the summer or inside if the weather is cold.  bring your kids before 7 and treat them to real pizza...the waitstaff loves kids and treats them extra nicely.  pastas and entrees are equally fantastic, and the bartender knows how to mix a proper old-fashioned.

Absolutely the BEST dining experience in Lincoln Park.  You will not find a cozier space with a friendlier staff anywhere in the city!!  Come with a date, come with a big group or come alone and eat and the beautiful lily filled bar... just make one stop to Tarantino's and you'll have a wonderful experience.  Here is a little help for you, start with the J Pinot Noir, order the parmesan encrusted warm shrimp salad and a 1/2 order of the rigatoni. (If you're with another person, order a full rigatoni and meat/fish dish and share.)  Cliche... but have the tiramisu... It tastes like Johnny's Nona is in the back making it herself!  Enjoy!

All italian restaurants should be like Tarantino's.  In fact, when you think of a great italian restaurant, this is what you're picturing.  Great atmosphere, quiet but not tiny, fantastic food, great wine list, friendly servers, and delicious specials.  Tarantino's is one of the few restaurants where you get the sense that everyone who works there really cares about the restaurant and whether the customers are happy.  Service is attentive but not smothering, specials are unique but not strange, and I've never had a bad dish.

You can't beat the service and food quality at this fantastic restaurant.   The people who work there are great. There are always fresh flowers at the bar.  If you're with people who aren't fans of Italian there are fantastic specials and fish dishes that I highly recommend.    Jim is the best bartender in town and most of the servers are very knowledgeable about their wine selection. Outdoor seating in the summer is great.  The indoor dining is fantastic with the perfect decor for a business dinner or a dinner with friends & family.  Watch out first time daters: If you're seated at the high-top tables near the bar and windows and need to run to the restroom, local singles tend to eat at the end of the bar alone and your date will be considered open game after only a single glass of wine.   If it's a first date head to the back!  Great service, great food and a great location.   There are also several wonderful neighborhood bars to hit after a great dinner here.

Great Italian restaurant! The service is excellent. I've been here at least 5 times and the restaurant is never packed even on weekends nights which I find odd because it is great food. The food is sort of pricey but it is well worth it. The pork chop is so amazing, supposedly one of the best meals in Chicago and after one bite I can see why. My boyfriend and I love this place! Def. would recommend it!
This is a great place to catch up with friends. The atmosphere is cute and the risotto..heck yeah!

I would say Tarantino's is fine, plain Italian food.  Nothing more, nothing less.  I was very impressed with the atmosphere - a beautiful restaurant - and the service was wonderful.  But the food did not stick out on any level.  Their "spicy" pasta was not spicy at all, even when ordered extra spicy... which is fine if you don't want spicy at all but if I didn't want spicy then I would  not have asked for extra extra spice.  I don't know, maybe I should have gone Mexican that night.  I'll try it again if I'm in the mood for plain Italian. Also, if you bring your own cake, FYI, they cut it into VERY small pieces!!  Request normal sized slices of cake.

How have I never reviewed Tarantino's!? Wow. And I am even more surprised to see that so few reviews have been written! This place is wonderful! One of my favorite restaurants in Chicago, Tarantino's is a cute, cozy space with friendly staff, consistent food, a nice wine list and reasonable prices. Whether I am sitting at the bar waiting for friends and enjoying a glass of wine or enjoying service at a table, the bartenders and servers here are friendly, happy to have you there and pay the perfect amount of attention.  Tarantino's is a great place for anything from an intimate date to a girl's night out. Favorites include the farfalle w/chicken, tomatoes & spinach in garlic & olive oil; fusilli with sausage & tomato cream sauce; butternut squash ravioli and the lamb shank.  Always a delicious, laid-back time at Tarantino's! They are also on  restaurant.com  so keep an eye out for great gift certificate deals.

I've been to Tarantino's a few times. It's cute neighborhood place and the food is consistently pretty good.  The service has been different each time I've gone. The first time, it was hectic; our server was clearly overwhelmed and over-sat. Our drinks were delayed and almost forgotten. The second time, however, the service was nice and laid back. Our server was attentive, helpful, and funny. She definitely seemed knowledgeable with regard to the wine list and menu, and offered various pairing suggestions. I have had the rigatoni with mushrooms, sun-dried tomatoes, proscuitto, and peas in a cream and parmesan cheese sauce and the fusilli with sausage in a spicy tomato cream sauce. I liked the look and sound of the fuisilli better, but I preferred the rigatoni. Both are definitely good. And actually I think the fusilli makes better leftovers than the rigatoni; which brings me to another point worth mentioning: the portions are nice and generous. The pizzas are delish, more like a traditional Northern Italian pizza - very, very thin, not so saucy. Reminded me of the pizzas they serve at Volare, which are even better. Not a fan of the Caesar Salad - very bland.  Also, a member of my party ordered the lamb shank medium rare and it was cooked practically well done, which was definitely disapointing. Desserts were fine, we were all just very full...and a little tipsy.

A restaurant named after one of my favorite directors? Ok, it's not but still very good. The server was funny and personable, the martinis were great, and the food was the best part. The decor is also very cool with giant posters of old wine ads and small enough of a place to seem cosy.
